title: Proclamation Honoring George Washington's Birthday, 2026
summary: The President issues a proclamation commemorating George Washington's birthday and recognizing his roles in the American Revolution and the founding of the United States. The proclamation notes the 250th anniversary of American independence and designates February 22, 2026 as Washington's Birthday, inviting the nation to reflect on Washington's leadership, legacy, and contributions to liberty and the nation's founding principles.

title: Executive Action Modifying Tariff Duties in Response to Actions by the Government of the Russian Federation
summary: This presidential action, authorized under authorities including the International Emergency Economic Powers Act, the National Emergencies Act, and section 604 of the Trade Act of 1974, modifies the duties applicable to goods of the Russian Federation as part of the administration's measures to address national security concerns posed by the Government of the Russian Federation.

title: Executive Action Establishing a United States Arms Transfer Strategy Prioritizing American-Made Military Equipment
summary: This presidential action, issued under the President's constitutional and statutory authorities, directs the development and implementation of a United States arms transfer strategy. Section 1, Purpose, describes the objective of prioritizing American-made military equipment in defense exports and aims to leverage domestic manufacturing capabilities. The action calls for coordination among relevant federal departments and agencies to implement the strategy, including alignment of export controls, licensing processes, and arms-sale decisions, and requires ongoing reporting on progress and implementation to ensure alignment with national security and policy goals.

title: Executive Order to Protect National Security and Public Welfare from Criminal Actors and Other Public Safety Threats
summary: This executive order, issued by the President under constitutional authority and federal law, including 6 U.S.C. 122(a)(2), establishes the policy to safeguard the national welfare and security of the United States and its citizens from criminal actors and other public safety threats. Section 1 sets forth the policy and directs federal agencies to undertake coordinated measures to counter such threats and to enhance national security and public safety.

title: Proclamation Designating the Northeast Canyons and Seamounts Marine National Monument Under the Antiquities Act (Proclamation 9496)
summary: This proclamation, issued on September 15, 2016 by President Barack Obama under the Antiquities Act (54 U.S.C. 320301), designated approximately 4,913 square miles of Atlantic Ocean waters and submerged lands at the boundary where the Atlantic Ocean meets the continental shelf as the Northeast Canyons and Seamounts Marine National Monument, establishing federal protection for the area.

title: Presidential Proclamation on Ensuring Affordable Beef for the American Consumer
summary: This proclamation issued by the President discusses the importance of beef in the American diet and acknowledges the historical role of cattle ranchers in U.S. history. It states the objective of ensuring affordable beef for American consumers and outlines considerations related to beef production and the availability of beef across markets. The document highlights the governmentâ€™s interest in supporting the cattle industry and maintaining a stable supply chain to promote access to beef for consumers.

title: Nomination of Michael McDonald to Chair the National Endowment for the Humanities for a four-year term
summary: Michael McDonald, a resident of the District of Columbia, has been nominated to serve as Chairperson of the National Endowment for the Humanities for a four-year term, succeeding Shelly C. Lowe. The nomination was announced as part of the White House's nominations sent to the Senate.
